Class Card

java.lang.Object
Card
public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
This is a class designed to represent a playing card. The suit values should PROBABLY be set in an ENUM but we will add that later.

This object is known as a POJO or a Plain Old Java Object. It represents a piece of data, in this case a single playing card.

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card​(java.lang.Integer value, java.lang.String suit)
      This is the only constructor.
      Parameters:
      value - the numerical value of the card.
      suit - this is the 'class' of the card (Club, Diamond, Heart, Spade)

  • Method Details

    • getValue

      public java.lang.Integer getValue()
      returns the value of the card

    • setValue

      public void setValue​(java.lang.Integer value)
      sets the value of the card... this should really be deprecated since once the value is set, it shouldn't change... Unless we are playing sabaac
      Parameters:
      value - the value to set for the card.

    • getStringValue

      public java.lang.String getStringValue()
      This is an interesting method. It uses a switch statement to convert the numerical value (1-13) to a string representation. This is interesting because cards 1,11,12, and 13 have special names (ace, jack, queen, king).
      Returns:
      a string representation of the value.

    • getSuit

      public java.lang.String getSuit()
      returns the suit of the card. or possible the suite

    • setSuit

      public void setSuit​(java.lang.String suit)
      sets the suit of the card. Like 'setValue' this should probably be deprecated.
